definition: to pursue sth back to its origins/to trace back to the source/to get to the bottom of sth
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to go upstream/to trace the source
root/source/origin

sentences.english: The author firstly reviews the historical evolution of WTO secretariat.
sentences.chinese: 筆者首先從歷史的角度對祕書處做出了追根溯源。

sentences.english: The recent economic downturn has come about due to many different factors.
sentences.chinese: 近期是經濟低迷時期，若要追根溯源，更是不一而足。

sentences.english: It is impossible to trace out by history what kind of man he was.
sentences.chinese: 不可能通過歷史追根溯源查出他是一個什麼樣的人。

sentences.english: Anjiacha gold deposit is a bedrock gold deposit which was discovered by tracing placer gold.
sentences.chinese: 安家岔金礦牀是由砂金追根溯源而找到的礦牀。

sentences.english: The second-part studies the origin of the ecocriticism.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分追根溯源探討生態批評的理論淵源。

definition: to trace sth back to its origin
to trace sth back to its source/to get to the bottom of sth
see 追根溯源[zhui1 gen1 su4 yuan2]
origin/root (cause)
to track sth to its roots
to investigate the origin of sth/to trace a river upstream back to its source
to originate
to get to the heart of the matter
the whys and the wherefores/the detailed story/root cause
to trace something to its source (idiom)
to look into (a matter)
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
to investigate/to delve/to probe/to enquire into/to look into
see 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]
to seek/to pursue/to investigate
